org.odftoolkit.simple.presentation

Class SlideTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.odftoolkit.simple.presentation.SlideTest

  • public class SlideTest
extends Object
    Test for Presentation Slide API, including get/move/insert/delete slide in one presentation and the slides operation of two presentations.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Initialize the test case.

    • Method Detail

      • testGetSlide

        public void testGetSlide()
        Test case for get presentation slide, including get the slide count, get the slide at the specified position or with the specified name, and get the collection of slide.

        Precondition Load Presentation File at test\resources\performance\Presentation1.odp Method 1)By using PresentationDocument.getSlideCount() to Get the number of the slides in this presentation. 2)According to the slide count, get a slide at the specific position of the loaded presentation document using PresentationDocument.getSlideByIndex(int index), and the param "index" should be limited with the slide count. Use OdfDrawPage.getSlideIndex() method to verify the returned slide. 3)PresentationDocument.getSlideByName(String name) 4)Using dfPresentationDocument.getSlides() to get the slide iterator Covered Element <office:presentation>,<draw:page> Note PresentationDocument.getContentRoot override Document.getContentRoot method will return OfficePresentationElement, rather than OdfOfficePresentation because of the inheritance relationship broken up between dom and doc element And because OdfOfficePresentation is useless, so I delete this class Code Coverage Result 1)can not catch Exception because it is only used to catch the exception thrown by getContentRoot()

      • testSlideName

        public void testSlideName()
        Test case for get/set slide name to make sure the name is unique in the whole presentation document. If the loaded presentation document is not valid that contain the same slide name, we should modified the duplicate slide name to make them unique.

        Precondition Load Presentation File at test\resources\performance\Presentation1.odp Using the dom method to make slide index 4 and 8 have the same name, and delete the "draw:name" attribute of slide 7. Method 1)By accessing any slide API to trigger the duplicate slide name check method. After this operation, slide 8 will change the slide name. 2)Trigger OdfDrawPage.getSlideName() to make the slide 7 has the unique slide name. 3)Using OdfDrawPage.setSlideName() to give the slide 1 with the new name.

      • testDeleteSlide

        public void testDeleteSlide()
        Test case for delete presentation slide, including delete slide at the specified position or with the specified name.

        Precondition Load Presentation File at test\resources\performance\Presentation1.odp Method 1)By using PresentationDocument.deleteSlideByIndex(int index) to delete the slide at the specified position which is present by param "index", then index of the slide which after the delete slide will change. 2)Delete slide with the specified name by using PresentationDocument.deleteSlideByName(String name) PostCondition Save the modified document at SlideResultDelete.odp Covered Element 1) <office:presentation>,<draw:page> 2)All the element that contains "xlink:href" attribute, such as <draw:object>, <draw:image>, etc. 3)All the style name definition element, include <style:style>, <text:list-style>, <number:time-style>, <number:date-style>, <number:boolean-style>, <number:number-style>, <number:currency-style>, <number:percentage-style>, <number:text-style> 4)All the OdfStylableElement which have the style name reference, such as <draw:frame>, <text:p> etc. Note When the specific slide is delete, if it referred images, ole or styles are not used by other slide they will all be removed from the package.

      • testNewSlide

        public void testNewSlide()
        Test case for create new slide at the specified position, with the specified name and slide template.

        Precondition Load Presentation File at test\resources\performance\Presentation1.odp Method PresentationDocument.newSlide(int index, String name, OdfDrawPage.SlideLayout slideLayout) is used to new a slide at the specified position with the specified name, and use the specified slide template. Postcondition Save the modified document at SlideResultNew.odp Covered Element 1) <style:presentation-page-layout> referred by "presentation:presentation-page-layout-name" attribute of <draw:page> 2) <style:master-page> referred by "draw:master-page-name" attribute of <draw:page> 3) The placeholder element of <draw:page>, such as title, outline placeholder Note The new slide will use the same master page style of the previous slide, and add the placeholder on the slide according to the slide template parameter.

      • testMoveAndCopySlide

        public void testMoveAndCopySlide()
        Test case for move the slide from one position to another, or copy a specified slide and insert it to another specified position.

        Precondition Load Presentation File at test\resources\performance\Presentation1.odp test\resources\performance\Presentation1.odp Method 1)Using PresentationDocument.moveSlide(int current, int destination) to move a slide at the current position to the destination position. 2)PresentationDocument.copySlide(int source, int dest, String newName) is used to make a copy of the slide at a specified position to another position in this presentation. Postcondition Save the modified document at SlideResultMoveAndCopy.odp Covered Element 1) <office:presentation>,<draw:page> 2) <presentation:notes> of each slide. Note Each slide has its own notes page to show its notes view, while the notes page has the "draw:page-number" attribute to show the notes view of which slide so when the slide is moved or copied, the index of this slide will be change, the notes page have to change the "draw:page-number" value.

      • testCopyForeignSlide

        public void testCopyForeignSlide()
        Test case for copy a slide which comes from the other presentation to the specified position of the current presentation.

        Precondition Load Presentation File at test\resources\performance\Presentation1.odp & test\resources\performance\Presentation2.odp Method Using PresentationDocument.copyForeignSlide(int destIndex,PresentationDocument srcDoc, int srcIndex) to copy a slide which locates at "srcIndex" position of the "srcDoc" presentation document and insert it to the current presentation document at "destIndex" position. Postcondition Save the modified document at SlideResultCopyForeignSlide.odp Covered Element 1) <office:presentation>,<draw:page> 2) All the element that contains "xlink:href" attribute, such as <draw:object>, <draw:image>, etc. 3) Each style definition element of <draw:page> and its all child elements such as layout style, master page style, object style and text style the style definition element must contain "style:name" or "draw:name" attribute, include <style:mater-page >,<style:page-layout>,<style:presentation-page-layout>, <style:style>, <text:list-style>, <number:time-style>, <number:date-style>, <number:boolean-style>, <number:number-style>, <number:currency-style>, <number:percentage-style>, <number:text-style>, <text:outline-style>,<style:font-face>, 4) the element which refer the style name, that is <draw:page> and all the child elements. Note If the copied style/image/ole name is duplicated with destination presentation document, the name definition element and reference element must be renamed then insert to the dest document.

      • testAppendPresentation

        public void testAppendPresentation()
        Test case for appending all the slide of one presentation to the end of another presentation.

        Precondition Load Presentation File at test\resources\performance\Presentation1.odp & test\resources\performance\Presentation2.odp Method Using PresentationDocument.appendPresentation(PresentationDocument aDoc) to append the specified presentation to the current presentation. Postcondition Save the modified document at SlideResultMerge.odp Covered Element Same with CopyForeignSlide method, except that it covers all the slide element of the document,rather than specific slide. Note 1)You'd better check the generated document to look at if there are any object/style is lost. 2) The generated file size will be larger than we append by using OpenOffice/Symphony, that is because the styles and images from the different document might have the same content, but I still append them rather than use one copy, because compare the odf element content and the image stream might cost much time.

      • testAnotherMergeDoc

        public void testAnotherMergeDoc()

      • testCopyThreeDoc

        public void testCopyThreeDoc()
        Test case for merge the three presentation document

        Precondition Load Presentation File at test\resources\performance\SlideTest1.odp, test\resources\performance\SlideTest2.odp and test\resources\performance\SlideTest3.odp Method copy the slide from SlideTest2.odp and SlideTest3.odp to SlideTest1.odp Postcondition Save the modified document at SlideResultCopyThreeDoc.odp Notice This test case is used to show that the style name can be renamed if they define the different style.
